title: Nuclear power plants : permanent shutdowns 2005 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of shutdowns, with a total of 15 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately positive which exists from 2019 to 2016.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2010 to 2007.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2016 to 2014.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2014 to 2012.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2012 to 2010.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2007 to 2005.
